books.author: George Orwell
books.synopsis: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother. Winston Smith secretly rebels against constant surveillance and propaganda, questioning truth, freedom, and individuality in a world of oppression.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.synopsis: Through the eyes of young Scout Finch, the novel explores racial injustice in the American South as her father, Atticus Finch, defends a Black man falsely accused of a crime.

review.comment: A deeply moving story about justice and empathy.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.synopsis: Nick Carraway narrates the tragic story of Jay Gatsby, a mysterious millionaire obsessed with rekindling his love for Daisy Buchanan during the glamorous yet hollow Jazz Age.

review.comment: A beautifully tragic tale of love and ambition.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.synopsis: Holden Caulfield recounts his days in New York City after being expelled from school, revealing his struggles with alienation, identity, and the loss of innocence.

review.comment: A relatable story about growing up and feeling lost.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.synopsis: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected journey with a group of dwarves to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug, discovering courage and adventure along the way.

review.comment: A magical adventure that never gets old!

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.synopsis: In a futuristic society driven by technology and pleasure, individuality is suppressed. Bernard Marx begins to question a world where happiness is manufactured and freedom is sacrificed.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.synopsis: Explores the history of Homo sapiens from ancient ancestors to the modern age, examining how biology, culture, and technology shaped human societies.

books.title: Educated
books.author: Tara Westover
books.synopsis: A memoir of Tara Westover’s journey from growing up in a strict, survivalist family with no formal schooling to earning a PhD from Cambridge University.

books.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
books.author: Anne Frank
books.synopsis: Anne Frank’s diary documents her life in hiding during World War II, offering a deeply personal and moving account of hope, fear, and resilience.

books.title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
books.author: Rebecca Skloot
books.synopsis: Tells the story of Henrietta Lacks, whose cancer cells were taken without her knowledge and became one of the most important tools in medical research.

review.comment: A fascinating story blending science and ethics.

books.title: Outliers
books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.synopsis: Examines the factors behind extraordinary success, arguing that culture, timing, opportunity, and practice play a major role in high achievement.

review.comment: Makes you rethink what leads to success.

books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.synopsis: Provides practical strategies for building good habits and breaking bad ones by focusing on small, consistent improvements over time.

review.comment: Practical tips that are easy to follow.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.synopsis: Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of manners, upbringing, and marriage while clashing with the reserved Mr. Darcy in this timeless romantic comedy.

review.comment: A timeless romance full of wit and charm.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.synopsis: An orphaned governess, Jane Eyre, falls in love with the mysterious Mr. Rochester while uncovering secrets that test her morals and independence.

review.comment: A beautifully written story of love and resilience.

books.title: The Notebook
books.author: Nicholas Sparks
books.synopsis: A lifelong love story between Noah and Allie, whose romance faces social barriers and the test of time.

review.comment: A heartfelt story that brings tears and smiles.

books.title: Me Before You
books.author: Jojo Moyes
books.synopsis: Louisa Clark becomes a caregiver for Will Traynor, a paralyzed man, and their unexpected relationship changes both of their lives.

books.title: Gone with the Wind
books.author: Margaret Mitchell
books.synopsis: Set during the American Civil War, Scarlett O’Hara struggles to survive and find love amid the destruction of the Old South.

books.title: The Fault in Our Stars
books.author: John Green
books.synopsis: Teenagers Hazel and Augustus fall in love while battling cancer, exploring themes of life, death, and meaning.

review.comment: Heartbreaking and inspiring all at once.

reviews.comment: A powerful and disturbing vision of the future.
One of the greatest love stories ever written.

review.comment: A powerful and disturbing vision of the future.
